result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo L Luckett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the Gangster Disciples.  Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo L Luckett

records.addlTxt: letter from defendant regarding current case & probation
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to prison.
Defendant has completed the Earned Release Program and balance of time is converted to Extended Supervision.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system
does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State indicated they were Chapter 950 compliant, one correction to PSI re: description of offense
Defense had corrections to PSI re: attorney added, sibling, residential history

State recommends prison and probation
Defense requests prison on 2 counts concurrent, and then probation. 

BTC:  count 1:  WPS 6 years (3 years IC & 3 years ES)
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare, and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
no association, directly or indirectly, with Gangster Disciples
full time employment
comply with child support and family court orders
CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample, unless one already on file with DOC

count 2:  WPS 4 years (2 years IC & 2 years ES)
same conditions
consecutive to count 1.

count 4:  WPS 6 years (3 years IC & 3 years ES)
same conditions as count 1
IMPOSED AND STAYED - probation 3 years
same conditions
consecutive to counts 1 & 2.

count 5:  WPS 6 years (3 years IC & 3 years ES)
same conditions
IMPOSED AND STAYED - probation 3 years
same conditions
consecutive to counts 1 & 2 but concurrent to count 4
If revoked, consecutive to counts 1, 2 and 4.

Firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assmt on each count
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Attorney Mindy Nolan in court.  No appearance for the State of Wisconsin as Ms. Sommers was needed in another court.  Atty Nolan waived the defendant's appearance for today.

Per Atty Nolan, she was just appointed Mr. Nolan's attorney on Wednesday.  She has talked with him and mention was made of his withdrawing his plea.  She will keep the court advised in the event that happens.

BTC:  November sentencing date stays on.  Atty Nolan to advise in writing if plea is withdrawn.
Status conference on September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel. Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on Motion to withdraw as counsel.  
Per Atty Kuehn, defendant has requested that she withdraw, and she is relocating.

BTC:  Withdrawal granted.  New PD to be appointed.  Set for STC to see if new counsel appointed.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Filed pro se. Cc: Atty Kuehn, ADA Tanck-Adams
Motion hearing on August 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Offer:  Cts. 1&2, rec 3 yr init/3 years es, consec to each other and any other sentence;  Cts. 4&5, 6 yr init/2 yr es, I/S, 3 yr prob.
Plea:  Cts. 1,2,4,5 - G.
BTC:  Cts. 1,2,4,5 - GUILTY.  Cts. 3,6,7 - DRI.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Plea hearing on June 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defense requests COP  Plea hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Kuehn on behalf of the Defendant

Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in custody.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Lorenzo L Luckett in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
